sub_title: Showing You the Future of Vision Software in Logistics | Marketing Specialist | English/Russian Translator | Study Abroad Alumni Ambassador
summary:
Meeting interesting people, trying new things, spending time on social media, researching, and writing: what do all of these things have in common? 

Yep, that's right: I love to do each of these, and as someone who works with all things Marketing & Communications, I get to incorporate them in my day-to-day work.

Pretty cool, right? 😎 But I wasn't always on the path to this career field. My academic background is actually in Political Science & Business Economics, and content creation is just something I was passionate about alongside my studies. But after trying my hand at marketing, social media, and communications, I realized rather quickly that this was the life for me. I've now put my skills to the test in a number of different industries -- ranging from credit insurance (B2B), to education (B2B & B2C), to artificial intelligence (B2C & B2B), and so much more (B2B & B2C) -- and I couldn't be more excited to see what's next for me in this journey.

Outside of my Digital Marketing work, I also spend a lot of time volunteering with expats and students as a mentor, translator, and tutor. As an immigrant who received very little guidance during their academic and professional career, I know what it's like to feel lost and uncertain, and I want to offer support to young professionals who find themselves in a similar situation.

As of 9 years ago, I am also an independent fashion model, collaborating primarily with up-and-coming photographers and sustainable brands. Modeling started out as a way for me to build my confidence, and it turned into something that allows me to meet new people, raise awareness for worthwhile causes, and offer exposure to brands and individuals in the fashion industry whose mission I support.

So, if you're...

👉 Wondering what life is like in the Digital Marketing, Social Media, and Communications industries
👉 Trying to switch to work in those fields but aren't sure where to start
👉 Curious to know how to pursue work outside of your primary academic study
👉 A student/recent graduate seeking mentorship, guidance, or advice
👉 Just looking to get in touch about something else

...Don't hesitate to send me a message! I'm only one connection request away 😊

projects.title: Chan With A Plan: Podcast Feature
projects.description:
EPISODE SUMMARY: In this episode of Chan with a Plan, Max Chan speaks with Marina Krivonossova, a professional in Public Relations & Communications. In this conversation Marina discusses her transition internationally for schooling and work as well as her use of LinkedIn to network to grow her career.

QUOTES
“I've never done anything with LinkedIn. Because I think as many people, I had the belief that like LinkedIn is just where you paste your resume. You say I'm humbled to announce my new job, things like that. But I was like, No, there's got to be something more to it.” – Marina Krivonossova

“Networking is huge here. And I mean, currently the company for whom I work, we organize, you know, a few annual conferences, we always place a huge emphasis on networking and the networking opportunities we offer. And we know our clients are extremely keen on that, they want to meet other people in their industry in similar industries, just in other industries, and networking is a huge thing for them.” – Marina Krivonossova

“You should really just push past the initial awkwardness of starting to post and start posting about what you're interested in, I would really say that you don't even have to pick a specific field of interest at the beginning, you should just start posting and see what feels comfortable.” – Marina Krivonossova 

AUDIO LINK: https://chanwithaplan.podbean.com/e/how-studying-and-working-abroad-can-change-your-life/

projects.title: Marble and Sculptor: A Personality Type Manifesto by Joe Arrigo (Edited by Marina Krivonossova)
projects.description: After MBTI specialist Joe Arrigo told me about the new book he was working on, I knew I wanted to join in and be part of the action. Luckily for me, Joe asked me to come on board the project as his editor, and the rest is history! Helping him expand on his ideas and ensure that the book was perfectly polished, I spent several weeks working closely with Joe to ensure that the final product was a masterpiece (and it is -- find out for yourself!)

projects.title: Stand Up for Human Rights: Podcast
projects.description:
I created a podcast (Stand Up for Human Rights) in collaboration with GHRD in which I featured guests to speak with me on topics pertaining to human rights. The purpose of our podcast was to shed light on human rights issues around the world, as experienced and learned about by individuals within different areas of life. The podcast was extremely short-lived, at only one season of four episodes. It was a very fun and interesting project to undertake, but unfortunately, it proved to be much too time-consuming for something that I was doing for free on the side, alongside my other work and volunteer projects. I hope that despite my departure from the podcast, GHRD continues to keep conversations going around this incredibly important topic.

This podcsat was even featured on BizCatalyst 360: https://www.bizcatalyst360.com/standing-up-for-human-rights/

projects.title: It's the Journey: Podcast Feature
projects.description:
Join me and Carlo as we talk about taking risks, trying new things, facing fears, and watching life take surprising twists and turns before our very eyes, especially when we least expect it to. 

Episode 39: https://carloblog.com/podcast/episode-39-marina-krivonossova-facing-fear-marinas-advice

Episode 40: https://carloblog.com/podcast/episode-40-marina-krivonossova-finding-time-to-make-a-difference

And, be sure to check out Carlo's other amazing podcast guests, as well as the incredibly book he wrote!

contributors.headline: Showing You the Future of Vision Software in Logistics | Marketing Specialist | English/Russian Translator | Study Abroad Alumni Ambassador

projects.title: My Worst Investment Ever: Podcast Feature
projects.description: I spoke as a featured guest on Andrew Stotz's podcast My Worst Investment Ever. During the episode, I shared details about an unfortunate experience of mine when I first moved to the Netherlands as an international student. I trusted the wrong person with my money, I was lost and alone in a country where I didn't have anything, and I didn't know what to do or where to go. Life happens, and we live, and we learn! My only hope is that folks learn from my negative experience and avoid repeating my naive mistakes.

contributors.headline: Showing You the Future of Vision Software in Logistics | Marketing Specialist | English/Russian Translator | Study Abroad Alumni Ambassador

projects.title: Shine Abroad: Podcast Feature
projects.description: Adele Testa, The Coach, interviewed me about my experiences as an expat from California living in the Netherlands. We talk about issues that many expats encounter, such as dealing with homesickness, adjusting to life in our new country, finding a community which we feel a part of, and much more.

projects.description: Join me and Joe Arrigo as we talk about my LinkedIn posting strategy, my life as an ENTP, and our connection over anti-human trafficking efforts. And be sure to check out Joe's YouTube channel for more awesome MBTI-themed videos!

projects.title: The Dutch Guide to Healthy Living: Podcast Feature
projects.description: I was featured on Jillian O'Mara's podcast on life in the Netherlands -- specifically on episode 4, in which we compare and contrast work-life balance expectations in the US vs. the Netherlands. It was a unique opportunity during which I got the chance to reflect on my time spent working in both countries up until that point in time.
